column1: Uchi////Overall the sushi quality was good... not outstanding and def not 4.5 yelp stars outstanding.  I get it
column2: its difficult to get really fresh sushi in Houston.  Pieces that left more to be desired -- bonito and arctic char.  The best courses were the hotate
column3: and amberjack for that everning.  The remaining courses were interesting in that the chef likes to mix textures and flavors
column5: some didn't (chocolate dessert didn't do so well).  My favorite non-nigiri dish was the cooked salmon with the fried salmon skin - really tasty.  One big disappointment was what the waiter touted as their most popular dish
column6: the hamachi-orange -- highly disappointing.  The orange slices where big and way too sweet
column7: really washed out any hamachi flavor
column8: really not well executed at all.
